newsitem.title: INDIA: India shares up in kerb deals, govt sops seen.
newsitem.headline: India shares up in kerb deals, govt sops seen.

text.p: Leading stocks firmed up in kerb deals late on Tuesday on growing speculation about government policy announcements expected this week, dealers said.
In late evening, Reliance was quoted at 282.0 rupees up from Tuesday's official close of 280.50 rupees. ITC rose 12.0 rupees to 415.0 and TISCO 2.0 to 213.0 and SBI was up two rupees to 214.50.

Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda on Monday said new economic policy measures would be announced in the next few days. "Some decisions will be coming in the next two to three days," the prime minister told a business gathering in Bombay.
The Bombay Stock Exchange's top 30-share index has rallied 169 points, or nearly five percent this week ending Tuesday at 3,604.20.
